Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Simulated Altitude Exposure for Preoperative Optimisation

Participants.evidence: Eight participants aged 50-70 years, with a sedentary lifestyle

Intervention.evidence: randomised to experience one week each of normoxic and hypoxic conditions

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the physiological effects of one week of simulated altitude in older sedentary volunteers.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in anaerobic threshold, measured via cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET) before and after each exposure.

Blinding.evidence: participants, outcome assessors, and clinicians were blinded

Number_Analysed.evidence: All eight participants completed the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: hypoxia induced a significant increase in haemoglobin (mean increase 1.5 g/dl, 13%, p=0.028)
